schemas.title: Schemas
schemas.description: The list of schemas to sync from. Defaults to user. Case sensitive.

username.description: The username which is used to access the database.
username.title: Username

password.description: The password associated with the username.
password.title: Password

jdbc_url_params.title: JDBC URL Params
jdbc_url_params.description: Additional properties to pass to the JDBC URL string when connecting to the database formatted as 'key=value' pairs separated by the symbol '&'. (example: key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3).

ssl_method.title: SSL Method
ssl_method.description: The encryption method which is used when communicating with the database.

oneOf.title: Unencrypted
oneOf.description: Data transfer will not be encrypted.

oneOf.title: Encrypted (trust server certificate)
oneOf.description: Use the certificate provided by the server without verification. (For testing purposes only!)

oneOf.title: Encrypted (verify certificate)
oneOf.description: Verify and use the certificate provided by the server.

hostNameInCertificate.title: Host Name In Certificate
hostNameInCertificate.description: Specifies the host name of the server. The value of this property must match the subject property of the certificate.

certificate.title: Certificate
certificate.description: certificate of the server, or of the CA that signed the server certificate

replication_method.title: Update Method
replication_method.description: Configures how data is extracted from the database.

oneOf.title: Read Changes using Change Data Capture (CDC)
oneOf.description: Recommended - Incrementally reads new inserts, updates, and deletes using the SQL Server's change data capture feature. This must be enabled on your database.

initial_waiting_seconds.title: Initial Waiting Time in Seconds (Advanced)
initial_waiting_seconds.description: The amount of time the connector will wait when it launches to determine if there is new data to sync or not. Defaults to 300 seconds. Valid range: 120 seconds to 3600 seconds. Read about initial waiting time.

invalid_cdc_cursor_position_behavior.title: Invalid CDC position behavior (Advanced)
invalid_cdc_cursor_position_behavior.description: Determines whether Airbyte should fail or re-sync data in case of an stale/invalid cursor value into the WAL. If 'Fail sync' is chosen, a user will have to manually reset the connection before being able to continue syncing data. If 'Re-sync data' is chosen, Airbyte will automatically trigger a refresh but could lead to higher cloud costs and data loss.

queue_size.title: Size of the queue (Advanced)
queue_size.description: The size of the internal queue. This may interfere with memory consumption and efficiency of the connector, please be careful.

initial_load_timeout_hours.title: Initial Load Timeout in Hours (Advanced)
initial_load_timeout_hours.description: The amount of time an initial load is allowed to continue for before catching up on CDC logs.

oneOf.title: Scan Changes with User Defined Cursor
oneOf.description: Incrementally detects new inserts and updates using the cursor column chosen when configuring a connection (e.g. created_at, updated_at).
